actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide a refundable income tax credit for the purchase of a new principal residence.
short_title: Emergency Home Purchase and Housing Inventory Reduction Act of 1982

summary.text: Emergency Home Purchase and Housing Inventory Reduction Act of 1982 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow individual taxpayers an income tax credit equal to five percent of the purchase price of a new principal residence. Limits the dollar amount of such credit to $5,000. Specifies that such credit shall be available with respect to only one residence of the taxpayer. Requires the recapture of credit amounts for the purchase of a new principal residence if such residence is sold within 36 months after the date of acquisition.

titles.title: Emergency Home Purchase and Housing Inventory Reduction Act of 1982
A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide a refundable income tax credit for the purchase of a new principal residence.
